title: Ticket #4440: cream_gahp fails at startup due to lt_dlopen() search path
description:
When the Globus threading model is set to something other than "none", Globus uses lt_dlopen() to load a Globus library with relevant functions. In the cream_gahp, we set the threading model to "pthread" because we use Globus and OpenSSL functions in multiple threads and need the proper synchronization.

Unlike the system dlopen() on linux, lt_dlopen() ignores the program's RPATH when searching the requested library. Therefore, it won't find the Globus libraries that we include with the UW release of HTCondor. Thus, the cream_gahp fails at startup with an error like this: dlopen libglobus_thread_pthread: file not found

There are a couple workarounds for this problem:

  • Install native Globus packages. lt_dlopen() will then find the library in the standard system location.
  • Set LD_LIBRARY_PATH to "$ORIGIN/../lib/condor".

One way to fix this is to use dlopen() to load the library at the top of main(), before Globus's call to lt_dlopen().

Setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the environment at the top of main() does not work. The ltdl library is probably checking the environment variables when it's loaded, before main().
